message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
for (Map.Entry<K, V> entry : map.entrySet()) {
    sortedEntries.add(new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue here is that some implementations of Map.EntrySet() may reuse the Entry objects for each iteration. This means that if you add the Entry object to another collection, and then the Entry object is reused in the next iteration, the value in your other collection will change as well. To avoid this, you can create a new Entry object for each iteration and add that to your collection instead. This ensures that the value will not change when the Entry object is reused.
